CVE-2022-1388 is a critical iControl REST authentication bypass vulnerability affecting different versions of F5 BIG-IP.<crlf>F5 BIG-IP could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper input validation. By sending specially-crafted requests to the management port and/or self IP addresses, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands, create or delete files, or disable services on the system.

Quarantine potentially affected hosts<crlf>Reimage the infected hosts<crlf>Collect and review data, artifacts, and relevant logs.<crlf>Upgrade F5 BIG-IP software to fixed versions (organizations using versions 12.1.x and 11.6.x should upgrade to supported versions).<crlf>If unable to immediately patch, implement F5s temporary workarounds<crlf>Check more information on the implementation of the workarounds here.<crlf>Maintain and test an incident response plan.<crlf>Prioritizes patch management and vulnerability scanning.<crlf>Configure internet-facing network devices<crlf>Check more considerations and guidance in case of suspecting a security compromise here

Snort signature for especially those organizations who did not immediately patch:<crlf>alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS (msg:BIG-IP F5 iControl:HTTP POST URI /mgmt./tm/util/bash and content data command and utilCmdArgs:CVE2022-1388; sid:1; rev:1; flow:established,to_server; flowbits:isnotset,bigip20221388.tagged; content:POST; http_method; content:/mgmt/tm/util/bash; http_uri; content:command; http_client_body; content:utilCmdArgs; http_client_body; flowbits:set,bigip20221388.tagged; tag:session,10,packets; reference:cve2022-1388; reference:url,github.com/alt3kx/CVE-2022-1388_PoC; priority:2; metadata:service http;)

CVE-2022-1388 is a critical iControl REST authentication bypass vulnerability affecting different versions of F5 BIG-IP.<crlf>F5 BIG-IP could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper input validation. By sending specially-crafted requests to the management port and/or self IP addresses, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands, create or delete files, or disable services on the system.

Snort signature for especially those organizations who did not immediately patch:<crlf>alert tcp any any -> any $HTTP_PORTS (msg:BIG-IP F5 iControl:HTTP POST URI /mgmt./tm/util/bash and content data command and utilCmdArgs:CVE2022-1388; sid:1; rev:1; flow:established,to_server; flowbits:isnotset,bigip20221388.tagged; content:POST; http_method; content:/mgmt/tm/util/bash; http_uri; content:command; http_client_body; content:utilCmdArgs; http_client_body; flowbits:set,bigip20221388.tagged; tag:session,10,packets; reference:cve2022-1388; reference:url,github.com/alt3kx/CVE-2022-1388_PoC; priority:2; metadata:service http;)

CVE-2022-1388 is a critical iControl REST authentication bypass vulnerability affecting different versions of F5 BIG-IP.<crlf>F5 BIG-IP could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper input validation. By sending specially-crafted requests to the management port and/or self IP addresses, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands, create or delete files, or disable services on the system.
